page.title: 10SALISBURY MARKET
page.content: Salisbury Market has about 100 stalls. On Market days coaches bring in shoppers from surrounding villages. The Market held by Charter from 1290, forbids the holding of any other market within 6.4 miles. One lady has been coming to the market for 25 years, she told us that it is a very good market. She needs to arrive at the market early to set up her stall. There were many people buying and selling goods when we visited the market. It was very busy. Most of the stalls sell clothes but some people were busy buying their vegetables and fruit. We saw many people selling flowers and plants for the garden. We also saw one man selling computer cassettes. Some of the stalls are put up around the Medieval Poultry Cross.
